name: connectome2tck
description:
Extract streamlines from a tractogram based on their assignment to parcellated nodes.

The compulsory input file "assignments_in" should contain a text file where there is one row for each streamline, and each row contains a list of numbers corresponding to the parcels to which that streamline was assigned (most typically there will be two entries per streamline, one for each endpoint; but this is not strictly a requirement). This file will most typically be generated using the tck2connectome command with the -out_assignments option.

References:
author: Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au)

inputs.name: tracks_in
inputs.description: the input track file

inputs.name: assignments_in
inputs.description: input text file containing the node assignments for each streamline

inputs.name: prefix_out
inputs.description: the output file / prefix

inputs.name: nodes
inputs.description: only select tracks that involve a set of nodes of interest (provide as a comma-separated list of integers)

inputs.name: exclusive
inputs.description: only select tracks that exclusively connect nodes from within the list of nodes of interest

inputs.name: files
inputs.description: select how the resulting streamlines will be grouped in output files. Options are: per_edge, per_node, single (default: per_edge)

inputs.name: exemplars
inputs.description: generate a mean connection exemplar per edge, rather than keeping all streamlines (the parcellation node image must be provided in order to constrain the exemplar endpoints)

inputs.name: keep_unassigned
inputs.description: by default, the program discards those streamlines that are not successfully assigned to a node. Set this option to generate corresponding outputs containing these streamlines (labelled as node index 0)

inputs.name: keep_self
inputs.description: by default, the program will not output streamlines that connect to the same node at both ends. Set this option to instead keep these self-connections.

inputs.name: tck_weights_in
inputs.description: specify a text scalar file containing the streamline weights

inputs.name: prefix_tck_weights_out
inputs.description: provide a prefix for outputting a text file corresponding to each output file, each containing only the streamline weights relevant for that track file

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: display version information and exit.
